item.title: How Mike Waltz is leading the Trump administration's 'a la carte' approach to UN funding
item.description: The new U.S. ambassador to the United Nations has been making the case that the United States will no longer be footing the bill the way it has since ...

item.title: Food banks are preparing for a surge as federal food aid could be paused in the government shutdown
item.description: Food banks and pantries are preparing for a surge in demand if federal food aid is paused this weekend from the government shutdown

item.title: Chicago's children are getting caught in the chaos of immigration crackdowns
item.description: In Chicago, children and families have been traumatized by an immigration enforcement action involving tear gas

item.title: Florida man convicted raping and killing his neighbor in 1998 is set to be executed
item.description: A man convicted of the 1998 rape and killing of his neighbor is set to be the 15th person executed in Florida this year

item.title: 'We have to be good or ICE will get us': Takeaways from Chicago children caught in immigration raids
item.description: Some Chicago parents and teachers say children were traumatized by a recent immigration enforcement action involving tear gas
